DOC.brief_summary: The objective study compare overall subjective preference filcon II 3 daily disposable silicone hyrogel contact lenses compare etafilcon A nelfilcon A daily disposable conventional hydrogel contact lenses .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation Daily Disposable Contact Lenses
DOC.detailed_description: Double-masked , randomise , control crossover trial . Subjects randomize wear one conventional hydriogel lens ; subject wear filcon II 3 lens . The first randomly assign lens type worn 3 day , daily replacement , follow 3 day wear lens type , daily replacement .
DOC.criteria: Is 18 40 year age ( inclusive ) Has selfreported visual exam last two year Is adapt soft CL wearer Must able wear lens least 3 full day , 10 hour per day , assume contraindication Has CL spherical prescription 1.00 6.00 ( inclusive ) Has less 1.25 D spectacle cylinder eye . Baseline vision 20/40 better ( eye ) habitual vision correction 20/20 bestcorrected . Is correctable least 20/25 distance visual acuity study contact lenses eye Has clear cornea active ocular disease Has read , understood sign information consent letter Is willing comply wear schedule ( least 3 full day ) Is willing comply visit schedule Has never wear contact lens . Currently wear rigid gas permeable contact lens . Has history achieve comfortable CL wear ( 3 day per week ; > 8 hours/day ) Has CL prescription outside range 1.00 6.00D Has spectacle cylinder great 1.25D cylinder either eye . Has best correct spectacle distance vision worse 20/25 either eye . Has systemic disease affect ocular health . Is use systemic topical medication , ( include rewetting drop , artificial tear allergy drop ) , affect ocular health . Occasional use acceptable trial . Has ocular pathology severe insufficiency lacrimal secretion Has persistent , clinically significant corneal conjunctival staining Has active neovascularization central corneal scar . Is aphakic . Is presbyopic . Has undergone corneal refractive surgery . Is participate type eye related clinical research study .
